Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello again!

After further investigation I am now able to pinpoint the iss=
ue more exactly. This morning I experimentally undid the rewritings of the =
urls in my archived page. And was surprised to see it work smoothly. I foun=
d out that the problem seems to lie in the css files or the rewriting of th=
e links to the css files. When I undo these rewrites the site comes up perf=
ectly. But I think this isn't the best solution as I still rely on the css =
files on the liveweb and not on my archived sites and files.

Maybe this he=
lps to get a little further?

Steph




________________________________
 V=
on: Steph <sherlock.h221b@...>
An: Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...>;=
 "archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com" <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com> 
Gesen=
det: 9:44 Donnerstag, 31.Januar 2013
Betreff: Re: [archive-crawler] Problem=
 with CSS
 

=C2=A0 
Hello Noah!

Thanks for your reply!

Yes, I use Waybac=
k Machine Beta for replaying it.

Like you said, I did a check for broken l=
inks this morning (using Xenu link sleuth) and now I'm really confused. Due=
 to the tests I did I got several archived versions of the said website. In=
 some cases Xenu says everything is alright, in other cases he reports an i=
ssue concerning a file named index.jsp because of server error (500) or (in=
 other cases) page not found (404).

I tried to find the jsp file to take a=
 look at it, but it won't show up anywhere. Neither in the live web version=
 nor in my archived version... But Xenu finds an empty url almost every tim=
e .


Steph





________________________________
 Von: Noah Levitt <nlevit=
t@...>

CC: Steph <sherlock.h22=
1b@...> 
Gesendet: 23:41 Mittwoch, 30.Januar 2013
Betreff: Re: [archi=
ve-crawler] Problem with CSS
 
Hello Steph,

Are you replaying your crawled=
 content using wayback?

You need to zero in on the issue. Browsers these d=
ays have a way to view all the requests and responses as they go by (web co=
nsole/net in firefox, developer tools/network in chrome, etc.) Open your ur=
l in wayback and look for 404s or other anomalies. When you
 see something =
is missing then you can try to figure out why. If you don't see anything mi=
ssing at least you've narrowed it down and can continue investigating elsew=
here.

Noah


On 2013-01-30 02:14 , Steph wrote:
>
>
> Hi everyone!
>
> I'm=
 new to this group and new to web archiving.
>
> I'm studying Media Preserv=
ation and for a project I try to save a few websites using Heritrix. It gen=
erally works really fine.
>
> But some websites really give me a headache, =
because the layout won't work. The images are all there, the Css files are =
also saved, but it won't show the defined frames! The content is just lined=
 up, one below the other, instead of beneath or above each other.
>
> I alr=
eady raised the number of MaxTransHops and SpeculativeHops and it worked fo=
r a number of websites, but not for this.
>
> One of the websites is http:/=
/www.landesarchiv-bw.de.
>
> Maybe you can give me some advice?
> It would =
be very appreciated!
>
> Thanks in advance,
>
> Steph
>
>
>
>
